reviewText:
I originally played this on my phone for the longest time, and was stoked to see it on steam.  It may be a little difficult at first, but when you get used to the difficulty level (think dark souls in 8 bit) it is loads of fun.  I've only beaten it 3 times (twice on phone, once on here) out of at least 150 games.  I recommend it to anyone who likes RPG's/Roguelikes.

This was my first roguelike and I haven't been able to stop playing since then.  I'd give it at least an 8/10, minimum.

I would suggest for first time players to play the mode without degredation, to get a feel for it.  When I first played it on the phone there was no degredation system, so that was a nice surprise when they updated it.

You won't regret picking it up.

reviewText:
Roguelike RPG video game port of the popular and super versioned title for smartphone.
Frustrating in the first rounds but extremely addictive. Don't give up.
Explore the depths of the Dungeon, collect lots of items, fight and discover new secrets on every game.

Highly recommended learn from the wiki:
http://pixeldungeon.wikia.com/
You'll discover new weapons, items and enemies you'd want to see in action.

You'll need quite lucky because the maps are random and you won't always get food on time.
Ration your food wisely if you do not want to die so fast.

Pros:
Very funny, easy to play'n enjoy and very random. Every new game is totally different.

Cons:
Really hard to finish. You most likely starve.

reviewText:
Pixel Dungeon is a very solid and enjoyable rogue-like.

It's quite traditional in it's mechanics and is most comparable to the original Rogue and Brogue.

The game is well presented, the interface is easy to understand and it isn't too hard to get a handle on the game-play, but like the games it has been inspired by - it is pretty challenging.

The pixel art is also really quite nice and the music/sound-effects do the job, the price for the Steam version is pretty reasonable too.

I would easily recommend this to anyone who enjoys rogue-likes and to those new to the Genre, Pixel Dungeon seems like it would make a good introduction for beginners.

reviewText:
I had to buy this as it is without doubt one of my favourite Android games ever. This version is more or less identical to the phone version and retains it's charming simplicity to play but is also very difficult to complete. It contains all the main elements of rogue-likes with the permakill and randomised item powers, but has the nice touch that tomes of mastery and armour kits become permanently available for the character classes after reaching certain levels.

Part of my hope in purchasing this is that the dev will continue to add new content now he has some cash behind him. The android version was regularly updated until a few months ago and I would love to see some new stuff going on.

My only grumble is that on linux the cursor has a blocky artifact around it which is a minor problem but would be nice to see it fixed.

10/10 Would hurl potions of flame at the Dwarf King again.

reviewText:
Oh my god I've been playing this game for 2 years on my phone! When i saw that there was a steam version of this game I was super happy about it! This is probably one of the best rogue like you can find on steam! Honestly thoght I suggest you to try it out on your smartphone first and buy the steam version ONLY IF you really want to give some money to the creators of the game.
here the links:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.watabou.pixeldungeon&hl=en
https://itunes.apple.com/app/pixel-dungeon/id1002210090

pros
+Awesome combat turn based gameplay.
+Self-generated floors filled with traps, secrets and special rooms making the game different every time you play it.
+Awesome classes well balanced and with totally different game mechanics.
+All the potions and scrolls that you find have hidden effects, untill you try them at your own risk ofcourse eheh.

cons
-Not really long, the game doesn't change much even thoght it's self-generated.
-Music may get a bit boring after some time.
-No rewards from dying before completing the game (except for the Huntress class if u beat the 3rd boss).
-No personalization, but you can live without it.

All the haters who judge this game are just mad casuals that can't get pass the first boss because they are so bad and then they unistall to go play some casual game for noobs.

reviewText:
Had this on my phone and it's one of the best mobile  roguelikes.   Fair warning though - it's not a hand-holder.

This game is HARD.

I've NEVER beaten it.  Ever.  Not on mobile or PC.

I must be a bit of a masochist but it's fun and challenging.  The few times I get a real run going, I feel triumphant.

If you want something easy to beat - it's not the game for you.  If you want a real roguelike with challenge (and possibly severe rage), it's totally worth it.  Is it based on luck?

To an extent, yes, but you're buying a roguelike dungeon crawler; that's the pretty much the definition of the genre.

The price is fair and the challenge is real.

reviewText:
A very nice mobile port. I've owned this game on my Kindle Fire for a long time, and it is fantastic. The price on Steam is very reasonable for the replayable nature of the game. Could use a volume level setting!

But first timers are probably asking, what kinda game is this?
1. It's hardcore-mode. Unless you have a special item (which I've never acquired until the first shop), when you die, you die, no second chance.
2. Almost entirely randomly generated. The rooms change, and the items/potions also change - what was a health potion last playthrough might be a Toxic Gas potion this time around!
3. The art style is pixelated, and very cute IMO.
4. The combat is simple turn based hack-n-slash, point-n-click, but don't let that stop you from trying it. It's still a very challenging game.
5. Watch out for hidden traps and doors! Use the search function to search nearby blocks, or cells".

If this is true to the mobile version

recommended: the game actually gets harder. Such a cool feature to me. If you're looking for a serious dungeon RPG or anything like that
hoursPlayed: this isn't the game for you. But if you want a casual
voteText: yet challenging experience that you can put down at any time (if you have the willpower)

reviewText:
Don't be put off by the small amount of time it shows me as having played this game, I've played the mobile version for hundreds of hours.

This is a quality roguelike. It has all of the elements of a classic roguelike, and more. For those familiar with the mobile version - you won't find any surprises here. If anything, the game is better to play on PC, as you don't have to squint at a tiny screen.

It's very accessible, but surprisingly deep. You need to think a little about your gear upgrades, and wait for that perfect drop. There's perhaps a little too much reliance on the Random Number Generator, but that's really the essence of a roguelike.

It has tonnes of replayability. Certainly, I've played it a great deal, and bought the PC version mainly to support the developer.

If you're into your roguelikes, you could certainly do a lot worse than this one - and for the price, it's a decent bargain.
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I wish I had a dollar every time I died playing this on my phone. I played so much I eventually downloaded the free PC version from the developer's website while waiting for this one. It's so good that I felt compelled to support the developer the moment I seen it released on Steam with achievements.

You will die often. I find it hilariously cynical. I don't really play many rougelike games. The only game like this I really loved was Fatal Labyrinth from Sega Genesis. Pixel Dungeon brings all the best elements and then some. I've been playing for over a month and I barely made it to the Boss on level 5  before it ate me.

I like the challenge and the random levels. It's kinda like poker. You will get awesome levels, just like a royal flush. You will also get â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ levels where ghosts chase you around. I love that I can be killed at any corner. It gives you a true sense of danger and keeps you from running around without thinking about it first.

I am giving a good review now but I truly hope that in the future we keep seeing updates that are cooler than the many modded versions on Android. I'll end with a list of missing features that I would love to see in the future.

Level Editor
Multiplayer
Controller Support
Mod Support
Create-A-Character
More customization options, rename characters, items, etc.

reviewText:
It's fun, but there is so much bullsh*t from the attack system and item drops that you pretty much will kill yourself in the first 4 levels. There are better dungeon crawlers out there although for a turn-based one it does things pretty well. My three major gripes with it are the Hunger System, Attack System and the Item System.

Hunger is bull, it's hard enough keeping your health up but having to go out of your way to search a level that may or may not have any food on it is stupid, either remove the system or reduce the frequency of its occurences because the Item System isn't helping either.

The Item System is interesting, the fact that with Potions, Armour and Weapons you don't know what will happen until you try it is cool, I really like that feature and find it a bit humourous when I drink a potion not thinking to just throw it first and then self-igniting myself. The issue with this system is that the items are rare and sparce, you may go through an entire level and pick up maybe 2-3 items (excluding Dew Drops and Seeds but they're not that useful). Also I often find that it's only after I reach level 3 usually that I actually have a new Sword and Armour, it's annoying that it's that far down and the enemies can do near identical damage to you which makes it a real pain when you just need a Healing Potion or some better armour but you can't get to it because you keep getting killed before you can find any, because the items are so rare in this game.

The last one, and I swear to eveyone's based god, the most crippling one to this game, the attack system. The attack system is absolute crap, you will miss more times than you will hit, while your enemies will hit nearly all the time. I can understand with an enemy like the Wraith, as its a ghost that it's hard to hit but when I start at full health with a Healing Potion and can't hit this guy once before dying, that's too far and the Wraith don't even do that much damage so it was a good 12-20 hits. The other thing is that enemies are almost random with the amount of damage they do, I've fought rats that'll deal 1 and 2 damage and I was thinking that I was going to kill it and then it deals a 5 and I'm dead, seriously, the second level introduces this enemy, I can't remember the name for but looks like a squirrel-sort of and it deals a consecutive 3-4 damage almost all the time where I'm luck to land a 6 on them. It's such a pain getting killed by a single creature and it's so annoying when the only thing it says above the enemy is evaded, evaded, evaded, dodged, dodged, evaded. It's painful to watch something like that happen.

So if you want a game that'll kill you within 4 levels with no more than 30 enemies get this game, but if your looking for a genuinly fun and enjoyable Dungeon Crawler where each venture is very different, then keep looking because this game is relentless.

reviewText:
I've been playing this on Linux, Ubuntue 14.04.  I haven't found any bugs yet.  It does not go full screen, but you can maximize the window and then have it scale to size.  The map can be zoomed but it doesn't affect text size.  This makes it pretty hard to read as I like to play on the living room TV from a lazy boy.

It's pretty addicting gameplay.  I like it, but it is a rogue-like. So, you will keep dying.  It's a chance game, sometimes you get lucky.  So if you can appreciate that, you may like it.  I haven't played much nethack, but enough to know this game is much simpler.  Sometimes simpler is what I need to have a little fun.

At first I thought you could not save your game, but you can.  It just doesn't tell you.  It's one of those that just saves whenever you exit.  So yeah good little rogue like dungeon crawler.  I wonder if I'll ever beat it one day.

reviewText:
This game aims to do accomplish something very simple, and it does that.

Not a game I would sing my praises about, but something I could honestly suggest to others.

A very well done Roguelite with just the right amount of elements to offer up replay and extra difficulty.

Easy to learn, difficult to master, being the mantra here. You'll find yourself coming back even after you've done some of the harder stuff, mostly just to say you still can.

Graphics: Solid and simple, very good choice for the game.

Gameplay: The sword seems largely useless, but the point of the game is using the tools you have correctly.

Sound: Music can be a bit repetitive, but the monsters are quite satisfying with their squish."

Overall: 7/10

reviewText:
Pixel Dungeon is a roguelike, Inspired by Brogue. You can choose from 3 character classes: the Warrior, the Mage, and the Rogue. You can unlock the Huntress at a later time. Your goal is to head to the bottom of the dungeon and escape with the prize. This game is quite challenging, with a large selection of weapons, armors, rings, potions, and scrolls plus a good amount of other items to play with.

It can be played with only the mouse, or only the keyboard, or you can use elements of both. Controls are very customizable and smooth. There's also partial controller support at the time of this review being typed(July 4th), however the devs are working on full controller support, and will be adding more content as the go on. Pixel Dungeon has been worked on for quite a while, as it was once a free game, and still is on the Android(and maybe iPhone), but the Steam version has far more content to offer than the mobile version.

The music it plays in the Main Menu is great alos, wish I had it. Anyway, if you're a fan of roguelikes, especially Brogue, then you should pick this game up.

reviewText: Great little dungeon crawler that I keep coming back to time and time again since I purchased it.  I die a lot so it's more of a casual rogue-like experience when I need to relax a little.  Personally I find the music to be really soothing and the graphics remind me a lot of those from the era of Ultima V.\n\nDefinitely recommended!

reviewText:
I've been playing this on Linux, Ubuntue 14.04.  I haven't found any bugs yet.  It does not go full screen, but you can maximize the window and then have it scale to size.  The map can be zoomed but it doesn't affect text size.  This makes it pretty hard to read as I like to play on the living room TV from a lazy boy.

It's pretty addicting gameplay.  I like it, but it is a rogue-like. So, you will keep dying.  It's a chance game, sometimes you get lucky.  So if you can appreciate that, you may like it.  I haven't played much nethack, but enough to know this game is much simpler.  Sometimes simpler is what I need to have a little fun.

At first I thought you could not save your game, but you can.  It just doesn't tell you.  It's one of those that just saves whenever you exit.  So yeah good little rogue like dungeon crawler.  I wonder if I'll ever beat it one day.
